Reviews.Title: “Good Value--Very Quaint”
Reviews.Author: Weers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel du Theatre in Paris after finding it on Travelzoo. We got it for a great deal and stayed for 3 nights in mid-March 2012. Arriving at the hotel was a great experience. It was a cute neighborhood away from the main attractions of the city, but virtually void of tourists. Lots of great cafes and amazing bakeries nearby, and the best part was having the metro stop just short walk away. The room was very basic, but what we had expected for the price. However, they did have a very nice, modern bathroom that seemed spacious in comparison to the room. The hotel staff was generally friendly, and helped us understand the metro lines and which stops to transfer at when visiting attractions. All and all, we found this place to be plesant and quaint. It had it's quirks, like the rock-hard bed and four flights of windy stair, but the quirks made it cute and feel authenic--it felt like we were staying at a little Mom and Pop's hotel on a little Paris side street versus a chain hotel on the main drag. Would definitely recommend for those who want to save some money, and don't mind staying a little ways out and using the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Great value stay”
Reviews.Author: Lowri J
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4days in total and what a wonderful hotel it was. Me and my Partner Dan thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We went for my birthday and they made ever effort to make it a fantastic day / stay Excellent value for money and will most definitely recommend to anyone looking for a nice warm atmosphere

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel with good location”
Reviews.Author: DalilahLisbon
Reviews.Content: We love the hotel du théatre: for Paris standarts, it was a pretty cheap stay for a comfortable and nicely located hotel. Very easy to get to the subway in two different stations and still a very quiet area, with several good restaurants and patisséries in a walking distance. The hotel is smal but cozy and the staff e extremely nice and helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: Sam M
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel, well located with a friendly staff. The night clerk even helped us order a pizza in. A great place to stay if you are on a budget in Paris. Very convenient to the Metro with shops and cafes in easy walking distance. The rooms are small, but don't feel cheap. It was quiet and I slept well. Literally next door to a theatre if that is what you like. A cafe to avoid in the area is Le Paris Rome. Very rude to non-French speakers.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: luigivilla
Reviews.Content: Location: The hotel is located very near the train station so it was easy to commute by train. There are restaurants and small shops around the area. Staff: The people (especially the guy named Soura) were accommodating and are ready to help guests. Room: The rooms are quite small but cozy enough. There are no aircons but when you leave open the windows, they are more than enough. Breakfast:There were 4 selections of breads, there were also cereals, juices, hot choco and coffee. quite good for me. Extras: There is free wifi in the room which I think is really helpful. The rooms have television but I think there was only one English channel. Overall, I will recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: pbackpacker
Reviews.Content: The hotel's entrance is located off a side street about three minutes walk from the Villiers metro station. There are no issues about safety though. Streets are bright, open and clean. Rooms aren't particularly big (typical parisian hotel size), but are nice and cosy. I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks, Tripadvisor!!”
Reviews.Author: bmurph74
Reviews.Content: Because of Hurricane Irene, we got stuck in Paris for two extra days. The tourism desk at the airport found a new hotel for us but it was TERRIBLE. We used their WIFI, got on tripadvisor and found this place. Good price, good service, and clean. We don't speak French, and they were fine with that. Your have your own bathroom (other place did not) Free WIFI, and an easy to use safe for your valuables. Good Neighborhood - lots of food choices and safe. About a 5 minute walk from the Metro. No AC controls in the room that I saw, but windows on either side of the room that opened kept it plenty cool. Good size bathroom/shower and a decent size room in general. In addition to the bed, we had a desk, 2 nightstands and a closet. CONS: Not the hotels fault, but the shuttle to the airport from here needed a 1-2 day notice to reserve it. We didn't do that, so we were forced to take a 55 Euro cab ride to the airport. TV only has two channels in English so we rented a few movies from iTunes at night when we were looking to save a little cash. It's on a small street not on the general tourist map that we used constantly, so it's more of a 10 minute walk from the Metro when you're trying to find the street. Small knocks on an otherwise great hotel that saved us from a bad hotel in a bad neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel, clean with friendly staff in an area where you can enjoy the real Paris without being too far from the main tourist”
Reviews.Author: Kavla-Australia
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at Hotel Du Theatre. It's greatest perk for us was that it is located in a great neighborhood where we were able to interact with locals and not be overwhelmed by fellow tourists. At the same time it was close to many of the tourist attractions and only a few minutes walk to the Metro if we didn't want to walk. Our room was small but clean. The bathroom was modern and had all the required amenities. There was no air-conditioning but the large French style windows opened up to provide a breeze and a nice view. We would recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, and nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: AndyJBrum
Reviews.Content: I'd read mixed reviews of this hotel, but we enjoyed our stay. If you want the ritz pay for the ritz! Arrived before 11, but our room was ready very quick. The reception was helpful. Rooms were a little small but this is because its an old hotel, but the decoration etc was good. Nice balcony onto the street. The hotel is very well placed with 2 underground stations close by and arch de triomphe is easily walkable. Breakfast was excellent, plenty to eat and a good choice overall well worth the money. From what we can read from the reviews its people expecting large modern rooms in an old hotel and a quiet street, there is nowhere quiet in central Paris,(we never heard any noise from a bar downstairs) Would go back

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel, decent location. Fantastic staff.”
Reviews.Author: Tahiri1321
Reviews.Content: The best thing of this hotel is the staff. They make you feel totally welcome and are extremely friendly. It is a budget hotel - no luxury. I would definitely go back if traveling under a tight budget, and can get a good rate for it. IÂ´d read it was noisy and something about a bar. They mustÂ´ve closed it because although our window opened to the street it was quiet. Not a place to sleep in late either, because you can indeed listen to everything that happens in the adjacent rooms (including night activities and vacuum in the morning). However, it was good for what we paid, and the staff is amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: USA123WashingtonDC
Reviews.Content: Stayed a night. Seems like a nice areas, but the Hotel is quite run down. It has no air conditioning. It has free wifi, but the speed is awfully slow.

Reviews.Title: “we enjoyed the place”
Reviews.Author: michal1973
Reviews.Content: Good location, young neighbourhood, many bars and restaurants around, nice, clean and comfortable room, some of the stuff is very nice and helpful (some are not...), nice breakfast (but don't expect vegetables or variety of cheese), free internet, cousy. We like a hard matress and this one was a little too soft for us, but we had known much worse in other hotels..

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good, but not the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: Lexis042
Reviews.Content: If you are looking to stay at the Ritz, go and stay at the Ritz. I stayed at Hotel du Theatre for 5 nights in March. The location is great. When you step outside of the hotel you can see Sacre Coeur Basilica and it's right near 2 metro stops (Rome and Villiers, lines 2 and 3). The rooms are small, but it's Europe so we thought it was fine. The rooms are also very dark, there is very little lighting and on our last day there one of the bulbs blew, making the room even darker. We booked through a third party website and paid 80 Euro/ night for a twin room with free breakfast. If you book directly with the hotel it's about 140 Euro/ night. I don't know why there's such large difference, but there is. There is free WIFI which was a bonus but no English channels on TV. I read in another review that they have English CNN but we were unable to find it. Our room was VERY hot. The heater was on full blast and you don't have control over the temperature, so you can't turn it down. Because of this we opened the window, but the street was very loud so we didn't get a lot of sleep on the weekend when the bar next door was busy. We found it really hard to find somewhere to eat near the hotel. We ate at La Gondole one night and it was really good, we ate at another restaurant on the main strip, it might be Chaptal... and it was really BAD. Service was just ok. No one went out of their way to help us. We hung the "do not disturb - no need to clean our room" sign on the door, but our room was cleaned anyways. The breakfast is good, it's a nice perk. It's a lot of bread, some juice and yoghurt. With everything being so pricey in Paris, this is definitely a plus. There is an elevator/ lift in the hotel, you can't fit more than 2 people in it. It's tiny but it works. Other than that it was a fairly good place to stay. If you get a deal it's worth it.

Reviews.Title: “The Romantic Place you wish to stay in the City of Love”
Reviews.Author: Flotschk
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay in Paris. Very friendly service! We arrived at 10 in the morning and they already had a room ready for us. When we got ready in our room, someone knocked at the door. They brought us croissants, coffee, tea, orange juice, yoghurts to our room! This is really anticipating the wishes of guests as if it were friends. I travel quite a lot for business and did not have anything like that in any five star hotel. This morning breakfast was not even included in the price. The service continued to be great, the location is very good (5 min to the metro station, walking distance to Louvre etc., safe neighbouhood even at late night). The rooms are small (but this is the center of Paris, whoever has friends living here will know this is typical here even for most flats) but charming and clean. The breakfast is continental, but this is typical as well, its not UK or Germany. I stayed in a well ranked 4 star in Paris before and there was not much difference. All in all, this was exactly what I was looking for: A romantic typical Parisian hotel - and the service exceeded any expectations.

Reviews.Title: “go there!”
Reviews.Author: etoges2010
Reviews.Content: it is a small and charming boutique hotel. do not expect the ritz but it is a small cosy place. the location is top and the staff helpful. we will go back. definitively

Reviews.Title: “don't go there at any rate”
Reviews.Author: bab2010
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel room by telephone a month before my trip to France. I received an e-mail confirmation and a reminder of my coming stay at L'hotel du Theatre a few days before my stay in Paris. When my husband arrived there the concierge looked peevish and told us that due to a mistake the hotel did not have any rooms left but not to worry, they owned another hotel 5 minutes away where "the rooms were bigger" and they will pay the taxi to the other hotel and will not charge for breakfast. I protested in vain. The concierge got a taxi for us to take us to the other hotel "The Romance Malesherbes" , a sorry looking hotel, stuck in a noisy street next to a cafe. Why the hotel carries 3 stars, I do not know! When we arrived we discovered that there has not been any communication between the two hotels so that the clerk balked at paying the taxi fare and when I reminded him about the free breakfast he said he did not know anything about that. He further said that I should not complain since they found me a nice room. The room in question was a small "mansarde" under the roof, nice enough because it had two windows facing each other which let a nice breeze in, but not worth the price tag of 210 Euros. The bed had no lining and the edges of the blanket were horribly frayed, one electrical outlet was pulled out of its socket, and we discovered that we had to pay for the WiFi. Not to mention the light in the elevator which turns off as the door closes.... and the suspicion of one of the employee that I took two breakfast because he saw me bring a coffee cup up in the room before breakfast. My husband and I felt like the two hotels owner ran a borderline illegal business, overbooking the rooms then shifting the overflow over to the lesser desirable hotel, thus taking advantage of helpless clients.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but would choose someone else next time”
Reviews.Author: myholiday1
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located near 2 main metro stations so access to all the places in Paris was easy enough. The hotel was nice, a bit small and the decor makes it seem smaller but i have no real complaints as we didnt havnt any issues with anything. If i was to return to Paris i dont think i would stay at the Hotel again as i think i could find a better hotel suited to my taste elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING !”
Reviews.Author: Nivardo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really nice, friendly staff (speak english), close to two metro stations (one block away) there is a Bar next to it (no noise at nights in the room). There is also many places to eat nearby. It might be samll for the american standars but it has EVERYTHING you need, bathroom very clean, TV very nice, bed very confortable (they only have single or double rooms). Breakfast was good also (continental), just check once you book if it is included. Will stay again ! they have WI FI !!! (for free)

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant boutique hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: paris1911
Reviews.Content: When I go to Paris, I do not want to waste money on hotels... As the phrase goes: Why are you in Paris? Not to stay in your hotel room! I prefer to concentrate on Parisian life, outside of my room, nice restaurants, museums, evenings at the theater (by the way, Hotel du Theatre is near my favorite theater,Theatre Hebertot, and I was told that French iconic star Jean-Louis Trintignant would rest at Hotel du Theatre when he was playing at Hebertot in Art by Yasmina Reza and in Comedie sur un Quai de Gare). Why is Hotel du Theatre the place where I stop regularly? First the location. See the site below: http://www.railways.incanada.net/Paris2006/Rue_de_Levis.html So close to Rue de Levis, a mini-Paris in itself, alive and colorful with its daily open air market where you meet real people (no tourists there!) and discover many little restaurants close to Hotel du Theatre that give you a real feeling for French traditional food (my favorite: Le Patio Provencal and Un Air de Famille). Close to the Villiers subway station from where I can travel easily all over Paris after getting my weekly pass (bring one recent small photo and ask for a weekly pass Navigo Decouverte, the cheapest way to travel by bus and subway). http://parisbytrain.com/paris-train-metro-week-pass-navigo-decouverte/ Moderate prices: why spend in hotel rooms what I love spending on books or gifts to bring back home? Warm welcome: the staff has always been most helpful with little requests of mine. Pleasant breakfast: hey, I am not there to splurge on breakfast.. Paris is for lunches or dinners! All I want is something to get me going: fresh coffee or tea, some pastries (they have a nice assortment of miniature croissants and brioches every day), OJ ad lib and here I hop on my bus to discover Paris. So their selection is pretty good for the price! Appropriate rooms, access to wifi, TV and radio, hair dryer, clean environment, that is enough. And one museum I recommend in the area: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mus%C3%A9e_Nissim_de_Camondo Hope you have a nice time in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “tres bon hotel”
Reviews.Author: Salomefrance
Reviews.Content: excellent rapport qualitÃ© prix: emplacement tres agreable et cdentral, hotel cosy avec une vraie atmosphere particuliere et staff sympa.

Reviews.Title: “peaceful boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: 2010parislover
Reviews.Content: we chose the hotel after reading the comments in tripadvisor... believe the best ones!!! the area is really convenient very close to the metro which drops you everywhere in paris. Close to the hotel the musee jaquemar andre, the grands magasins ans a lot of restaurants, Jogging in the parc moceau is just great.T The atmosphere in the hotel is really peaceful and we immediately felt confortable there.. the rooms are not large but not small and the staff helped us during our stay , booking at the moulin rouge, the bateau mouche and gave us a lot of useful details. internet in paris is not so frequent in paris. the computer at the reception as well as wifi in our room worked. We will return

Reviews.Title: “The most unfriendly, lazy and a "don't care" attitude staff that we encountered in France was at the Du Theatre Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: siebla
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 2 weeks in France in March. We were very happy with our trip to France except for our two stays at the Du Theatre Hotel in Paris. We would never recommend staying at the Du Theatre for the following reasons: During our first reservation, which was for 4 nights, the bathroom sink did not drain properly so the filthy and gross sink stopper was left sitting on the bathroom counter for the entire 4 day stay. The public computer was not working, the television in our room did not work, a light was out, and we had to ask for toilet paper and soap. Our second reservation was for 2 nights. When we arrived about 11:30 a.m., we were told rooms werenâ€™t ready as people were still checking out. We understood this and did not have a problem with it since earliest check in was listed as 12 noon. But we were also told not to worry that they would find a room for us since they owned 3 hotels in the area. I donâ€™t understand why they would say this since we had a reservation? After taking a shower and washing my hair the next morning, which was on our last day in Paris, I discovered the hair dryer did not work. The staff on duty took a cursory look and said they didnâ€™t have one for me. The man on duty also said when his manager came in later theyâ€™d take care of it and things would be better that evening. I once again asked in the evening for a hair dryer and got the same response. I got the distinct impression they really didnâ€™t care. Once again, the public computer had not been repaired, our room had a light that was out and we again had to ask for toilet paper and soap. Except for one gentlemen working in the evening on our first stay, the staff at the Du Theatre hotel were very unfriendly, appeared to us as lazy, and had a â€œdonâ€™t careâ€� attitude. I donâ€™t think they bother to check the rooms to see that they are ready for guests. I would definitely take this hotel off your recommended list. It taught me to always check a hotel room thoroughly before settling in.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel,no frills”
Reviews.Author: KateMcG
Reviews.Content: Got there after a delayed flight.Reception staff pleasant enough. No tea or coffee making facilities in room so asked reception if we could order some,it was after 12 at night and all cafes were closed. He apologised but left it at that,so went to bed thirsty!!. When I say went to bed thats as good as it gets.I`ve stayed in hotels all over the world and this hotel gets the trophy for the most uncomfortable bed. After 2 days both me and my partners backs were so sore we could hardly lift our bags.However the hotel is spotlessly clean,the breakfast is very basic but sufficient and it is close to all the attractions

Reviews.Title: “would return ....asap”
Reviews.Author: voyageurgeneve
Reviews.Content: we enjoy paris and the hotel good location good value and kind service next time in paris we will not look for an hotel but we will go back to the hotel du theatre...and its excellent croissants....

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't return”
Reviews.Author: mrsjones79
Reviews.Content: Found a cheap holiday, so tried to ignore the not so nice reviews. When I got there I wished I hadn't! I saw online that some rooms have private terraces, and emailed the hotel to ask if we could have one of these as the holiday was a celebration (husband birthday/end of my chemo). No one got back to me. We were put in room 2 in the basement (don't accept rooms 1 or 2), with a window facing onto a wall. The room was tiny. Hardly any space around the bed for moving. Given the size of the room, and the proximity of the toilet to the bed, there might as well not have been a door! The bed covers were also covered in stains. I'm sure they'd been washed, but I'd have binned them rather than use them. Also, the walls were paper thin...could hear all movement from next door, and the reception phone ringing. I asked if we could be moved rooms, and was told maybe tomorrow. After 5 minutes back in the room, maybe wasn't good enought, so I went back for a more certain answer (if not it was bad enough for us to leave). We were told a room would be free the following day, so decided to give it a shot before leaving. The next room (36) was much better. Larger room, larger windows, not a great view, but felt like there was air and light in this room. If I'd been given this initially, my view of the hotel wouldn't be so bad. Didn't eat breakfast. The condition of the first room put me off, and there was no tea/coffee making facilities. I knew it wasn't an expensive hotel, so wasn't expecting a lot, but space and cleanliness is a must. I'd say if you must go, make sure you're not in the basement. Oh, there's a bar next door. Lot of noise in the morning when they're clearing out last nights bottles.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic honeymoon in duTheare Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dawali
Reviews.Content: Our honeymoon in the Hotel was enjoyable and romantic thanks to the followings: The plesent attitude of the staff that was allways available and willing to fulfil our requests. The location of the hotel that was close to all the facilities that a tourist needs, restaurants, beautiful park, and the metro (we preferred to walk instead of using it) The room was neat and plaesent, the breakfast was tasty and rich (especially the croissons), no matter what the time was when we entered the dining room, there was never a lack of food. To sum up, the stay in the hotel made us feel like two parisians in love leaving in paris.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: MissSnej
Reviews.Content: Read the reviews on Tripadvisor, and booked a room for 2 people at the Hotel du Theatre for 3 nights in Paris. Overall, it was what I expected, small hotel with basic rooms and breakfast service. Pros: No problem checking in at front desk, hotel located on a quiet street, very close to Rome and Villiers metro stations, interior was nicely decorated, able to see the Sacre Coeur basilica up the main road, within distance to Moulin Rouge, and a bit further for to Arc de Triomph, lots of cafes, shops and a Monoprix supermarket closeby. Cons: Unfortunately, we were given the room right beside the front desk, the room was very small and tight , no AC, had to borrow a fan from the front desk, could hear people and noises from the main entrance, there were a couple of dark stains on the bed sheets, the main light switch broke on the second day, the drawers were not real-just for decoration, taps were very loud, and could hear other people using the taps and waking me up in the morning. We weren't expecting much food at breakfast, and were right, just mini croissants, cereal, yogurt, coffee and juice. Lastly, we had to return and collect the room key every time we left and came back to the hotel. Overall, this is a nice, small hotel worth the value if you are looking for basic accommodation in Paris and easy access to the metro.

Reviews.Title: “I felt like I was in Amelie's apartment!”
Reviews.Author: bluishlights
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not hard to find. We took the Metro from the airport and its just a couple of blocks from the Rome station. When we got there, I was so perplexed coz I forgot all my French except for "Bonjour!" But thank goodness the receptionist speaks perfect English!! It was so nice! We got our rooms on the top floor, their keys are so cute. Their elevator is so adorable as well. The room we got had a good view of the other buildings. It only has 4floors which is typical in Paris. They didnt have AC but we didnt really need it because it gets chilly at night and early in the morning. I love their windows! Our bed was a two twin beds in a queen sized bed frame. But who cares? The area is pretty quiet too. Even if we had a bar next door. The only thing was their garbage can is sooo small, located in the bathroom, and the only 1 in the whole room. And broken. Other than that it was great. The breakfast wasnt so filling though. Croissant and coffee. Anyway, it was okay coz you can always just grab a good breakfast in cafes along the way or crepes on the go. The have several cafes even before you get to the Rome station so its fine. They also have a free internet access by the reception area. Which was great since we didnt bring our laptop. Their lobby is soo adorable: with a bookshelf -- my kind of lobby. LOL. Everything about this hotel is so charming and lovely and feels so French. Like in a storybook. One of the most affordable in town too. Definitely coming back! LOVES IT!

Reviews.Title: “POOR”
Reviews.Author: MarkSk
Reviews.Content: In my opinion this is no three star hotel. Our room appeared to have either been half made up or perhaps used by someone earlier. There's limited space for your possesions as the drawers were all false and the wardrobe was half full of blankets and pillows. The rooms at the front of the hotel on the lower floors are well lit by the street lights outside, even with the curtains drawn. The hotel literature states that it is situated in a quiet side street. However, our first night was dominated by the music from the bar next door. I didn't go to Paris to listen to the Macarena at midnight! The noise from the plumbing in other rooms was pretty intrusive too. After our first night we asked to change rooms, citing the noise, the cleanliness of the room and the broken hairdrier (I was asked if I knew how to work one), but the receptionist didn't appear that bothered, almost as if they knew the room wasn't right in the first place. 'Laissez faire' would be a good way to sum up his attitude. The room we were allowed to use temporarily was much cleaner and clearly illustrated how unprepared our original room was. The breakfast was farcical. You have to get up early because it simply runs out and is seldom replenished. The woman in the dirty apron was more concerned with puting the clean glasses back on the shelf than noticing the orange juice, the "hot" water, the "cold" milk, the cardboard croissants and the Coco Pops (now that is criminal!) had run out. After research on Tripadvisor, I booked this break through Eurostar. It's my third trip to Paris and I would certainly say don't rule out hotels with a much lower rating to this one as in the past they've been much better places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A great little hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Dreamcatcher21
Reviews.Content: My wife and I celebrated 30 years of marriage in August and we stayed at the Hotel du Theatre for 2 nights. The staff are friendly, helpful and the Continental breakfast in the cellar just summed up everything we loved about our Parisian stay. We will definately come back to this hotel as it is in a great location with a wonderful view of Sacre Coeur from the main street.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel-remember it's Paris!”
Reviews.Author: treeno2
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at this place. Small rooms in a nice area with good transport links. Remember this is Paris and you need to pay for a really good hotel. This place did eXactly what was promised and is great as a base for sightseeing. Breakfast is Parisian style-bread, coffee and crossiants. Coffee was great. Staff really helpful and patient with my poor French even though they all spoke perfect English! I would stay here again and recommend to my nearest and dearest.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare. Make a stand and don't stay here.”
Reviews.Author: Jared82
Reviews.Content: We showed up at 6pm to find they didn't have a booking for us and the hotel was full. When we produced our laterooms confirmation email they changed their minds and said our credit card had been declined (which makes no sense as they are supposed to charge us on arrival/departure). ANYWAY, we asked them to find us an alternative near by so they sent us to another place around the corner that was the same price. Upon arrival the room wasn't great so we spoke to laterooms who found something nice for an extra Â£10 per night, on principle we asked that Hotel Du Theatre pay the extra Â£10 per night, to which they agree. We eventaully get to the new hotel around 8 or 9pm, then at about 10pm we're finally relaxing in our room and we get a call - its the guy from Hotel Du Theatre to tell me they aren't going to pay the difference because they thought we were staying at the place around the corner from them (assuming it was his friend and he had no intention of paying the difference). Arguing ensues, and I eventually tell him I'll call him on monday as at this point I've had enough. I tell laterooms and they speak to Du Theatre but get the same response, laterooms apologise and offer to pay us the Â£30 difference themselves. If you're a regular traveller you might know how painful this kind of thing is, so please make a stand for all travellers and don't stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Friendly, Helpful and Clean”
Reviews.Author: Mattsay
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights on a holiday trip to Paris, and was generally very pleased. The hotel is in a nice, safe location, good connections to the Metro (nearest station just a three minute walk), and the staff were generally helpful and pleasant. The room was adequate, it was clean, and the bathroom was small but perfectly fine. I have no complaints at all, and made my stay in Paris very easy.

Reviews.Title: “Not so great”
Reviews.Author: Fauchonlover
Reviews.Content: Our first night in Europe--in a nice location near Place de la Madeleine. We got the little room on the ground floor by the reception. It was very small and there was something depressing about it all. I cannot say it was a bad hotel or dirty or anything was wrong with it but we would never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and totally European”
Reviews.Author: l4lx
Reviews.Content: Very cozy and cute European hotel--the first night we were put in a double room (1 bed) in something of a basement--smelled like Grandma's closet; but the rest of the time we were moved into a fantastic twin bed room overlooking Rue de Cheroy. Watch the shopping, by the end of our trip we were climbing over the beds to get anywhere--very cozy rooms. Also for you summer travellers, please remember that there is no air conditioning in most European hotels at this price-- We were there during a 'heat wave', and opening the doors overlooking the street were quite a treat...a bit loud though, so take those ear plugs with you off the plane!! The breakfast was ok--bread, yogurt, warm milk, cereal--head to one of the local cafes for a cafe and croissant instead. Though you could waste your day sitting there chatting, so if you need something quick to get you going just hit up your free breakfast instead. The location is great--like everyone else said it was so easy to get anywhere. Though not very easy to get there from CDG. We took a taxi 45 euros, and on the way back took a shuttle (front desk will call for you) for roughly 37 Euros for 2 people. If you take the shuttle I suggest you know which terminal you need to be dropped off at and have the front desk tell the driver in French (or if you speak the language, tell him yourself). We ended up being dropped off at the wrong place--adding a half-hour onto our 'trip to airport' time. The first night we walked through the Moulin Rouge to Montmarte up to see the Sacre Coure. Absolutely beautiful at night. Grab a bottle of wine on your way and hang out on the steps of the Sacre Coure overlooking the city...awesome! Don't mind the greasy men trying to get you into the nudie clubs on your way there/back, the are harmless and just doing their jobs-- The cafes in that area are open very late--and it's just nice to sit and people watch. Everyone speaks English in this area, and really any tourist spot you go to! A drop of French goes a long way though...makes you seem friendly-- Also there is a place called Monoprix that is fabulous for grabbing gifts--we went to the one on the Champs Elysee, but there are a few in this neighborhood too. You can find Fauchon, Nutella, Kusmi teas, Valrhona choc, and many other things to take back. My friends loved the sea salt with the cork top; and chestnut creme sold in a box with 3 tubes (I split them up and wrapped them in French newspaper). They also have really cute chocolate bars (Marie Bouvero) with some of the hot spots on the wrapper--great place for gifts! Oh, and at 10pm the Eiffle Tower twinkles--GO!!...ABSOLUTELY BEAUTIFUL. And don't miss the gardens at Versailles!

Reviews.Title: “ideal!”
Reviews.Author: torontonianfolks
Reviews.Content: Perfect location in a very quiet area in the middle of the Opera district (almost no cars in that street). From that spot it's very easy to go everywhere for a stroll or to catch the bus or the subway (not even 5 minutes walking!). What I really appreciated was the human size of this charming hotel. The rooms could seem a bit small but the atmosphere is typically parisian: simple and stylish at the same time ... And the "croissants" for the breakfast: simply de-li-cious ... this is soooo french!!! Perfect if you want to spend a romantic time in the city of love with affordable prices!

Reviews.Title: “perfect to enjoy paris”
Reviews.Author: swisspax
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the hotel du theatre during december and we enjoed the champs elysees with all lights. the hotel is charming and warmful. the neighborhood is plenty of a lot of reataurants

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in very convenient location”
Reviews.Author: TheLondoner2
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at this hotel. The rooms were comfortable and the staff helpful. It was very well located, allowing easy access to the Champs Elysees, Montmartre etc. It was also great for shopping and dining. Don't hesitate to book your stay here.

Reviews.Title: “nice little hotel, in a great neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: travelbugjen
Reviews.Content: The hotel was on a quiet side street, at the top of the street away from the main road end are loads of little restaurants and bars - really nice safe environment. The hotel like all hotels i have stayed in in Paris, was quaint, tiny wee rooms, with only a wardrobe, no drawers for storing anything. Bathroom tiny but enough room to maneouver. We had a window that opended out into a small area within the hotel. Rooms were clean. Breakfast was included in our price - cereal, breads, croissants, yoghurts and juices teas and coffees. 3 min walk to metro station. I find that as long as you are near a metro in paris and that the hotel is 2/3 star you will be fine - they are all tiny anway unless you are going to pay megabucks!!

Reviews.Title: “Best value Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: dbliah
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is located next to the most interesting places to visit in the city. The fact that it's at walking distance from the Subway (Metro) makes it a very convenient area to be. Rooms and service are beyond expectations for what you pay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: ludomilia
Reviews.Content: Hotel du thÃ©atre is a very cosy hotel close to Montmatre area. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Very safe neighbourhood with plenty of restaurants, and two convenient metro stations. If you consider that the price is good for Paris standards, you can easily conclude that Hotel du Theatre is a really good option when visiting Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: yuringa
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a handy location with several neighbourly restaurants and bars. If you are looking for a reasonable hotel where you may meet some locals in an authentic neighbourhood this place might be a good spot.

Reviews.Title: “average hotel but definately not one to be avoided.”
Reviews.Author: TravellerUsk
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a quiet side street not far from the metro. We didn't realise quite how close it was to the Moulin Rouge area until we strolled up one evening, which was a pity as it had plenty of things to do and see there. The hotel was in walking distance of the Champs Elise (20 mins) and any reasonably fit person would be able to get away without using the metro. We walked everywhere, from Notre Dame to Sacre Coeur without to much effort. the hotelwas basic and comfortable thougha little jaded in decor. The room was reasonably sized for Paris. Unfortunately it wasn't quiet inside the room, and we could hear guets coughing all night in the other rooms. The breakfast was served in a very small basement room with everyone squashed in, but was a reasonably standard continental selection. All in all a fairly average hotel with nothing exceptional to note, either good or bad.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: walker061
Reviews.Content: My first trip to Paris began badly with a petty thief at the metro, and I walked up from the train with some trepidation. Imagine my delight when I emerged into a sunny tree-lined boulevard smelling of grass and flowers. From then on my Paris trip was all that I'd hoped for. The hotel was very clean, staff was friendly and patient with my poor French, and the breakfast room pleasant, with wonderful coffee. The streets near the hotel were filled with great shops and restaurants. It was an easy 45 minute walk to the Louvre or the Arche de Triomphe, and very close to two metro stations. I spent a very pleasant nine nights at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: travelgirly24
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after reading reviews on this site. I was not surprised by the size of the hotel and the facilities available. The location is not geared towards tourists but is fairly accessible to the main sites (2 tube stops away). However the hotel staff on duty that particular weekend sent four young girls to the red light district for a night out when asked to recommend a pub! They also claimed that all the shops were closed on a Sunday (not the case - particularly in Notre Dame). On the upside the bathrooms were very clean ( unusual for Paris) and the rooms were also clean and had most of the required facilities. If I was going to stay in Paris again I would stay in the Notre Dame area. The people are more friendly and helpful, there are loads of sites to see, shops to visit and reasonable but beautiful restaurants in which to dine! If you plan to stay in this hotel do your research and planning prior to your stay and do not rely on the advice of the their staff!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel du Theatre”
Reviews.Author: Traveller3265
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on TripAdvisor reviews and ratings, and I was a little disappointed. We were first given a room that had not been properly cleaned, and after some complaining they moved us to a different room. We were given two single beds pushed together despite the fact that I specifically asked for a double bed, but we were offered a double bed the next night. Breakfast was basic. Staff not particularly friendly or unfriendly. Location is good - near two train stations, but you mostly have to change lines to get to the main attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: se2007
Reviews.Content: Overall pretty pleased with our stay there as we felt it represented very good value for money. (Booked through hotelopia.com as it was cheaper than booking direct and this rate also included the continental buffet breakfast). The hotel is located in a quiet side street just a couple of minutes from the centre of Villiers which is quite lively and it is very easy to get to the centre of Paris from either there or Rome. Rooms are small but are adequately equipped with wardrobe, desk, bedside shelves, en-suite bath/shower and flat screen tv. Breakfast is a simple continental buffet affair but we found it satisfactory (it was included in our rate). If you are looking for a local restaurant you have to try A Table which is literally round the corner from the hotel. It is a small, fairly informal restaurant with extremely good food and reasonably priced. Positives: Very close to both Rome and Villers metro stations (5mins easy walk to either). Plenty of cafes and restaurants nearby if you want to eat in the area. Cheap for Paris. Decent breakfast. Although rooms are small they are perfectly adequate. Free internet access for guests via the computer in reception. Negatives: Small rooms. Fairly thin walls so if you get someone noisy next door and you're a light sleeper it could be a problem. Was woken up at 6.30am every morning we were the due to the rubbish collection truck driving past very noisily outside. Would be worth asking for a room that doesn't face the front of the hotel. In some areas of the room the decoration was slightly tired. Rooms get tidied but not thoroughly cleaned every day (sheets are not changed every day). This might be a problem in some peoples eyes.

Reviews.Title: “strange reviews”
Reviews.Author: JuliaBucharest
Reviews.Content: I have booked this hotel after reading all the wonderfull reviews . I did it 3 months before our arrival date and sent several e-mails to make sure everything is ok for us when we got there. When we arrive the room was not ready and they offered another one ... in contrary of what we asked for a double bed. They said that the cleaning lady had problems and they are waiting for her. We left our luggage there and left for lunch , we came back they said she has not arrived yet. We waited some more at the reception and suddenly we have seen the lady cleaning. So she was in the building but not doing our room. The receptionist started laughing went and spoke to the cleaning lady and than said in 10 min we will be able to get in. That was very rude. Second, indeed it was close to the metro but not 5 minutes from La Fayette Galaries ..it takes like 20 minutes walking. The area is pretty nice ,clean and peacefull. The hotel is ok , the rooms are small and the air conditioner is very old and makes funny noise. For couples the best restaurant i have ever eaten in my life is close to Tour Eiffel, at Trocadero station inside L`homme museum and it is called Homme Restaurant. The terace is a dream and the Tour is right next to you ... it feels like touching it. And go see Disney , it is absolut JOY .

Reviews.Title: “Credit card charging for nothing”
Reviews.Author: Lana_UKR
Reviews.Content: Iâ€™ve booked that hotel through the internet. We had to stay at hotel from May 9 till May 17. After reading review Iâ€™ve decided to rent an apartment instead, it was great idea as I understood after all. The thing is that Iâ€™ve canceled my reservation on March 18 (in advance) and according to cancellation policy without any penalty. I was â€œsurprisedâ€� when Iâ€™ve checked my credit card account and I saw that I was charged for non showing up (2 nights). On the negative side I tried to contact management (sending faxes, writhing letters, calling reception) I didnâ€™t get any explanaitionâ€¦.nothing. So If you donâ€™t want to have someone â€œplayingâ€� with your credit card donâ€™t book room at the Hotel du Theatre.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: elbmurts
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last year and after a long flight from Australia, it was an absolute pleasure to be greeted by a friendly face (by the way, the rumours about all Parisians being rude isn't true). The room was small but you expect that in much of Europe. It was clean and quiet. Hotel staff were without exception friendly and helpful. And breakfast in the very charming cellar was a great start to the day

Reviews.Title: “a very clean and friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: holsforus
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel in paris its central and easy to get to a metro about 4mins walk close to moulin rouge area, i took my parents and were very pleased with the hotel rooms and the cleanliness of them, good bathroom v clean, staff at hotel were friendly and i would recommend this hotel, we will be going back the fifields and lovedays of hampshire england

Reviews.Title: “A very Parisian hotel”
Reviews.Author: scan69
Reviews.Content: We spent a couple of days in Paris last week and we stayed at the Hotel du theatre, on the recommandation of a friend. We were not desappointed at all. Very warm welcome by a very professional staff. A lot of advices regarding typical restaurant in Paris Very well located in Paris, near buses and tubes Shall we return? Without any doubt.

Reviews.Title: “charming boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: lausannetraveller
Reviews.Content: i really enjoyed the area with its restaurants ( go to "a table"), the cosy atmosphere of the hotel and the rooms, wich are clean, not so small for paris and really calm!!! we will go back!

Reviews.Title: “A Gem of a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Darryl_Armstrong
Reviews.Content: A small but comfortable hotel in an excellent location for access to several sites of interest to tourists. Public transport connections are great with two metro stations within a few minutes walk and a bus route nearby. The front office staff were extremely helpful and offered advice on the sort of questions tourists always ask. The room we were allocated was entirely adequate, comprising a double bed, en-suite bathrooom, bedside clock radio and flat screen television. Breakfast was served in the basement restaurant and consisted of rolls, croissants, yoghurt, coffee, tea and juices. I would rate this hotel as a good find and will certainly stay here again. I will be happy to recommend this hotel to friends as offering comfort and good value in equal proportions.

Reviews.Title: “one word = excellent!”
Reviews.Author: eilattraveler
Reviews.Content: we stayed 4 days at the hotel du theatre. very charming, each detail is studied and the staff is really helpful. we loved beeing at one minute of the metro and at a walking distance of the grands magasins. another thing the restaurants in the area are delicious and do not forget the musee de camomdo >... a jewel

Reviews.Title: “Great value near Montmontre”
Reviews.Author: ssimmer
Reviews.Content: Deserves it's good review. Excellent value in a great part of town, very close to the Metro, walking to Montmontre, helpful staff, clean (small) rooms. You might find 2* hotels in similar back alleys nearby for a little less, but without the good service and fresh makeovers of the bed....

Reviews.Title: “We miss it already...!”
Reviews.Author: Smjjy
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I enjoyed a short stay at the Hotel du Theatre last month...the hotel was ideally located for us to enjoy both doing the tourist thing and seeing the real paris. You have an amazing view of Sacre Couer down the street, you're a short distance away from the Champs Elysee and the Arc...we couldn't have asked for a better hotel in terms of access to exploring the city. The staff were especially helpful and went out of their way to help us out...be it recommending places to go, or ordering us takeaway when we were too hungover to leave our room! The rooms may have been small for some people, but for us it was fine. No noise or disturbances at night that I can tell you of but obviously that is subject to change! The bathroom was clean, and although small was more than sufficient to our requirements. The room was clean and there was ample storage space for our belongings. The breakfast was lovely, we were both a big fan of the croissants, pain au chocolat and the bread rolls...very filling! We both made the most of the buffet especially when we didn't know when/where we'd next eat. We hope that this review has been of some use to you when selecting a hotel. We definitely intend on returning to this hotel in the near future..

Reviews.Title: “Antoine”
Reviews.Author: ghost2008
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, perfectly located for holidays or business. Rooms very cosy Staff very competent and nice Breakfast delicious A must if you're looking for an hotel in Paris!!

Reviews.Title: “Charming and helpful, but look after your belongings”
Reviews.Author: chart_cat
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a quiet but accessible retreat from the centre of Paris, the Hotel du Theatre is perfect. Its location between two Metro lines (a few minutes walk each) makes it within reach of all the major tourist attractions in the French capital. The local area is superb for winding down after a day of walking around the city. Just a minute down the street there is a lively restaurant area, with friendly bars and a mixed crowd. It's Paris as the locals do it, which makes a welcome change from the tourist hotspots. The open air market is colourful and packed with wonderful street sellers too. My wife and I stayed here for our first wedding anniversary so we asked for advice from the extremely helpful receptionist for a good table in a nice, local restaurant. She recommended Bistro de Theo, which was excellent. The receptionists were amazing, it should be stated. We arrived back late one night having failed to eat dinner. The chap on duty allowed us the use of the hotel kitchen, so we bought a few ingredients from the corner shop and made up a quick snack before we went to bed. Perfect! The only downside during our entire trip came after we returned home. I discovered that all my higher-value English coins had been selectively removed from my luggage sometime during our stay. Our luggage was always kept locked away either in our own room, or in the ground floor room used to store guestsâ€™ luggage after checking out, so you should draw your own conclusions from this. Overall, an excellent value hotel in a wonderful area of Paris that many tourists may never see. Just keep an eye on your valuables...

Reviews.Title: “Fine Hotel, great location away from the center”
Reviews.Author: Peacecow
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really a great location if you want to be more in a neighborhood away from the touristy center, yet still close enough to walk or take the metro. TWO metro stops are nearby as is the Park Monceau, which I love to walk on the way to either the shopping and Opera district or the Arch De Triomphe going the other direction. I took room number 3 on the ground floor and loved it. Nice full bed, clean. BE SURE TO ASK ABOUT PHONE RATES. I definitely got ripped off, being charged about 20 euro for three calls, 5 minutes max! I never dreamed this would happen so I did not bother to ask. The people are all very friendly and helpful AND you can use the computer in the lobby for free at any time of the day or night--VERY GOOD.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel ideal for visiting Paris”
Reviews.Author: GoldenGs
Reviews.Content: The rain poured, the wind howled but the weather could not dampen our spirits or the staff at the Hotel Du Theatre. On arrival we were met by the receptionist who was very friendly, spoke very good English and once we had booked in then continued to handout guide books, business cards so we would always be able to contact the hotel if we managed to get lost, brochures recommending various places of interest and directions to the metros (there were two within 5 mins walking distance) so we could commence our sightseeing almost immediately.We were made to feel very welcome indeed. A small hotel but our rooms were clean and comfortable and all the staff were very accommodating and always on hand to assist.Once our visit was complete the same receptionist ensured a taxi was avaialble for our return to the airport and that we and all our bags were on board before waving us off. The surrounding area had shops, restaurants, bars and an open air market and made a change from the hustle and bustle of central Paris. A hotel we intend to use for future visits to Paris and one we would reccomend.

Reviews.Title: “THE place to stay”
Reviews.Author: WellingtonDwarfs
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel - very clean and comfortable with very friendly and helpful staff. It is very central and easy to find, within 5 mins walk of either the Villiers or Rome metro stations. In one direction, Montmartre/Sacre Coeur a nice walk - maybe 30-40 minutes easy and interesting; in the opposite direction, Arc de Triomphe/Champs Elysee maybe 15 minutes including a lovely walk through the Parc Monceau. If you dine locally avoid Wepler - terrible food and service; couldn't get out of there fast enough, especially when you can do so much better. Theo is great - but 'A Table' is fantastic and will remain one of the absolute highlights of our trip to Europe - try the chocolate fondant dessert, it's to die for!

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: oliver019
Reviews.Content: very good staff the breakfast was brilliant and the room was quiet and very clean the people were very nice and helpfull

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, but be careful on reservations”
Reviews.Author: tkapts
Reviews.Content: This was one of the better 3* hotels I have stayed at in Europe, but beware when making a reservation. I booked through fastbookings; however when I checked in the front-desk staff had no reservation for me. They kept saying that there was no confirmation despite the fact that I had a print-out of an email subject: HOTEL BOOKING CONFIRMATION from the hotel's email address (which I matched with their business card). The desk staff even accused me of fabricating the email. At first, they said that the hotel was completely full. A friend of mine, who speaks fluent French, continued the argument. Finally the desk-staff said they had a room available for only 1 night with 2 beds, which was EXACTLY what I had reserved. The next day on check-out they said they finally received the reservation. Despite our check-in fiasco, we enjoyed our stay in this hotel. The neighborhood is nice and since the hotel is on a small side street, there was very little noise. Keep in mind that there are not many tourist attractions within short-walking distance, but there were plenty of cafes and easy Metro access. The room is small, but sufficient. I am not sure if I could handle the size if I stayed more than a couple nights. The bathroom was THE BEST 3* I have seen. It was large with good water temperature and extremely clean. For only 79 Euro and one night's stay, I don't think I could have found a better place: especially since I planned my trip last minute.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great service”
Reviews.Author: sydney_chick
Reviews.Content: To say that the staff are helpful is an understatement - they cannot do enough for you. The hotel itself is fine - it's not a mega chain, nor is it 4-5 stars, so don't go expecting that it will have every kind of luxury under the sun. What you will get is a clean room with enough space (seriously, who spends their vacation in their room anyway?) and super friendly service in a great location. I would stay here again, definitely. If you are staying here - go have dinner at Dome, which is next to the Villiers metro station on Rue de Villiers - and thank me afterwards!

Reviews.Title: “good base”
Reviews.Author: grant5
Reviews.Content: We have just arrived back from a family break in Paris, and stayed at the Hotel du Theatre. I would rate the hotel as a small Parisian hotel, with friendly staff. Who will always help you. The rooms were ample, with the towels being changed daily. They recommended a French cuisine restaurant (A Table) which went down a treat with the family. The location is just off the centre of Paris but with the metro links you are in the centre after three stops! It is a good base for people who want to see the sites and get a good nights sleep. Breakfast was more than enough.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: weloveParisEngland
Reviews.Content: Better late than never to add my thoughts on this charming hotel. I would echo all the positive reviews - yes the rooms are on the small side but thats the same all over and anyway who goes to Paris to sit in their room?? The price is fair - we didnt want to spend more, much rather spend money on dining out & sightseeing. My husband & I spent a 5 day break (for the 2nd time this year) here as it is a great quiet area to return to after a days sightseeing. The staff are very friendly & accomodating and the accomadation is clean & comfortable. Breakfast is very adequate and a very relaxed affair so a great start to the day. The metro stations are so close that getting to the heart of the city is easy. We didnt eat dinner locally until the 2nd to last night when we nipped around the corner to "En Table" (directions in hotel brochure) and wow! a fantastic place with wonderful friendly staff. It has only been open for 18months and is owned by a young man who speaks English & translates the menu with such passion that you are drooling before the food arrives! So fantastic we went back the following night again to sample some other dishes. * Highly reccomended* We are coming back in Nov & will be staying here again (& visiting En Table!)

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: bben07
Reviews.Content: we stayed two nights. we were charmed by the staff and the atmosphere. It is a nice boutique hotel. the area is wonderful with delicious restaurants espacially " a table" and theo!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money!”
Reviews.Author: Lizzy57
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights (18th-20th July 2007) and were really impressed. Yes, the rooms are a little small but perfectly adequate. The bathroom was fine, the shower was great. There was a fan in the room which we needed because we had arrived in Paris on a really hot day. The location is excellent, right near the metro, loads of places to eat nearby and the area is quiet at night. (we only heard pigeons!) Take a picnic to Parc Monceau to unwind from the tourist stuff, its only 10 minutes up the road and well worth a visit. You can park on the street but only for two hours at a time then you'll have to move, it is free after six pm on a Friday and all weekend so you might strike lucky. We parked at the secure car park just down the road, a bit expensive but worth it to know the car was safe. If you are coming into Paris from the North (A6) the hotel is easy find and you don't have to go round the Peripherique. We would definitely reccomend this hotel particularly if you want something with a bit of character. The staff were excellent, very helpful and watched the car while we sorted out our bags etc. The view of Sacre Coeur at the end of the boulevard when the sun sets is fantastic. We would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The fair price for a nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sawen
Reviews.Content: We booked it after having read the reviews of TA, and it was relly a fair deal! This is a very nice not pretentious little hotel, well situated in the 15th district of paris. We loved the neighborhood, which is not exposed to the noise or to a too great animation, but not far from it either. The access to the metro is very convenient and the good thing was that the metro line drove us directly and in less than 20 min to the latin corner and st germain. The room and breakfast were what we'd expected - good - and the staff was really helpful in helping us to find things to do - not just touristical ones. Overall a nice hotel for a very fair price.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: Stinger10
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights in early June 2007. We booked it based upon the TripAdvisor reviews and, for the most part, were not dissapointed. The location is a bit hard to find but once you get there access to everything is pretty good. There isn't much going on in the immediate vacinity but it isn't far from the major attractions and the metro stops are also close by. The staff was very friendly and helpful and the breakfast was fine. The only complaint I had was the room, although apparently non-smoking, had a strong smell of smoke. We learned to live with it but it wasn't terribly pleasant. The room was otherwise OK. It was clean and large enough (about average for our Europe stay) albeit quite tired. I wouldn't likely stay here again but, truthfully it was fine with the exception of the smoky smell and just being a bit old and in need of some TLC. I would just rather stay on the Left Bank.

Reviews.Title: “Nest to a lap dancing club!”
Reviews.Author: mgrinnan
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 3 night stay at the Hotel du Theatre. The room are small but clean. We had a major problem on Friday night--our room was right next to a lap dancing club which seemed to be having a loud party until 5:00 a.m.! If you stay here, definitely ask for a room on the other side of the hall. This was one of the worst nights I havve ever spent in a hotel. The staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, no problem stay!”
Reviews.Author: life_is_for
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Hotel for a three night stay in early May. First trip to Paris. Two near by metros. 15 minute walk to the Arc de Triomphe. Rooms are, as has been said before, small but clean and daily maid service. Only down point our room was on ground floor with no view at all, apart from other buildings looking down plus into small square across to other rooms. But hey who spends time in their room in Paris! Despite being on ground floor very close to reception, it was still quiet. Breakfast was great, in quaint cellar. Really no complaints at all. Staff were friendly and spoke good English. Would defintely recommend for a cheap stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely positive experience”
Reviews.Author: Dimitris72
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Hotel du Theatre for 4 nights and the overall experience was definitely positive. The hotel is between two metro stations (each one is 2-3 minutes by feet), which makes moving around Paris very easy. Some interesting places are in a walking distance (e.g. Montmarte, Park Monceau, Opera, Triumph Arc). Moreover, the area is quiet and safe. Finally, just a few meters away there are plenty of nice restaurants/cafes and a beautiful market full of colours and life (rue des dames and rue de levis, respectively). Staff was helpful and polite; they tried to help every time I asked something. The room was rather small, but this is common in old hotels in the center of big European cities. In any case I did not find the room size annoying. Morever, it was very clean, the decoration was cute and the bathroom adequate and clean. Finally, it is rather quiet, although some noise from water pipes is present at night. If you consider that the price is good for Paris standards, you can easily conclude that Hotel du Theatre is a really good option when visiting Paris. Hint: If you stay here, take metro line 3 to Levalois. After 3 stations is station Pereire; this is a beautiful round Place, full of flowers, plenty of cafes and restaurants around and -most important- no tourist. It's a good place to have dinner like real Parisian.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: irishmart
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel from 14/5/07 - 18/05/07. Very impressed, no problem checking in, and good polite staff manner at all times. Room was small but very clean, good sized bathroom, perfect for our needs visiting Paris. Very safe neighbourhood with plenty of restaurants, and two convenient metro stations. Had breakfast in hotel on one occassion , which was very pleasant and filled us up for the day. No negative comments at all, and we will visit again when in Paris

Reviews.Title: “wonderful staff - great location”
Reviews.Author: deaston
Reviews.Content: The location is so convenient, close to rue de Levis where there is every day a wonderful market and close to boulevard des Batignolles where every Saturday there is a superb bio market, an open air market with organic produce. The staff is most friendly, and gives helpful hints on what to do, where to go, how to get there in the most gracious manner. Rooms are just what you need when you are away: clean, comfortable, and modestly priced. My favorite restaurant in the neighborhood: L'Affiche and Wepler for their huge seafood platters or close to Gare St Lazarre, the restaurant Mollard, for seafood, a historic property worth the detour! Daniele Thomas

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, when they eventually found us a room!”
Reviews.Author: Hanbansan
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at this hotel after reading the positive reviews on Trip Advisor. After a terrible journey which involved our flight being diverted to Brussels, we arrived at the hotel 5 hours later than planned and were looking forward to having a rest and a bite to eat. When we tried to check in we were told that there had been a leak in our room and that a room had been found for us at a nearby hotel and that the hotel we were going to was just as good as the Hotel du Theatre. We were sent to the Ambassadeur Hotel which was, quite simply, one of the worst hotels I have ever stayed in. We immediately called the Hotel du Theatre to complain and they said that they would find a room for us the next day. So the next day we returned to the Hotel du Theatre only to be told that they were fully booked and had no room for us!! We demanded that they find us a room as we had paid for our room in advance and we were eventually checked into the hotel. From there on our stay was very pleasant - the room was small but well presented and the breakfast on offer was more than adequate. The only problem was they couldn't find the key to the safe in our room which meant we had to carry our passports etc around with us which was far from ideal. We were only in Paris for a few days and were disappointed that we had lost so much time trying to sort our accommodation out, even though we had booked and paid well in advance. Given that our experience was similar to a previous reviewer, who was also moved to an inferior hotel due to a leak in the room, I would not be inclined to stay at this hotel again. I would also urge the hotel management to either sort the plumbing out in their hotel or ensure that, if they are going to move guests to alternative hotels, they move them somewhere decent.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel du Theatre
HotelInfo.Address: 5 rue de Cheroy, 75017 Paris, France
